title: 115_hr5207
content: The "Immigration Advisory Program Authorization Act of 2018" or the "IAP Authorization Act of 2018" authorizes the Immigration Advisory Program under the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Immigration Advisory Program (IAP) authorizes US Customs and Border Protection officers to assist air carriers and security employees at foreign airports with traveler information review for flights to the US. Activities include being present during flight processing, document examination, security assessments, training, and analyzing passenger information. The Immigration Advisory Program (IAP) allows US Customs and Border Protection officers to analyze passenger data, confirm watchlist matches, make recommendations to airlines, and conduct security activities for US-bound flights. The Commissioner must notify Congress 60 days before agreements with host countries are finalized. The Commissioner must notify Congress 60 days before finalizing agreements with host countries for the Immigration Advisory Program. Congress must receive a copy of the agreement, country-specific information on homeland security benefits, and an assessment of the impacts of the agreement. The Commissioner must provide Congress with details on the impacts, costs, information sharing mechanisms, and other necessary factors related to agreements with host countries for the Immigration Advisory Program. Additionally, any substantially amended program agreement must be notified to Congress 30 days before entering into force. The Commissioner of United States Customs and Border Protection must provide Congress with any amended agreements with host countries for the Immigration Advisory Program, along with justifications for the amendments. Definitions for 'air carrier' and 'foreign air carrier' are provided in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 411 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new paragraph related to the immigration advisory program. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of contents. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new paragraph on the immigration advisory program. Passed by the House of Representatives on June 25, 2018.
